    1: from pandas import (
    2:     DataFrame,
    3:     Index,
    4:     date_range,
    5: )
    6: import pandas._testing as tm
    7: 
    8: 
    9: class TestToFrame:
   10:     def test_to_frame_datetime_tz(self):
   11:         # GH#25809
   12:         idx = date_range(start="2019-01-01", end="2019-01-30", freq="D", tz="UTC")
   13:         result = idx.to_frame()
   14:         expected = DataFrame(idx, index=idx)
   15:         tm.assert_frame_equal(result, expected)
   16: 
   17:     def test_to_frame_respects_none_name(self):
   18:         # GH#44212 if we explicitly pass name=None, then that should be respected,
   19:         #  not changed to 0
   20:         # GH-45448 this is first deprecated to only change in the future
   21:         idx = date_range(start="2019-01-01", end="2019-01-30", freq="D", tz="UTC")
   22:         result = idx.to_frame(name=None)
   23:         exp_idx = Index([None], dtype=object)
   24:         tm.assert_index_equal(exp_idx, result.columns)
   25: 
   26:         result = idx.rename("foo").to_frame(name=None)
   27:         exp_idx = Index([None], dtype=object)
   28:         tm.assert_index_equal(exp_idx, result.columns)
